reasoning: Chronic condition measured as prevalence rather than incidence. GERD with esophagitis (erosive esophagitis) is a specific subtype occurring in approximately 5-10% of GERD patients. Global GERD prevalence ~20-25% suggests erosive esophagitis prevalence of ~1.5-1.8% (1750 per 100k). Confidence limited due to lack of specific 2005-verified registry data.
